text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen the dish I'm 
making today is inspired by a Thai dish called gai

kluk foon now gai is chicken and kluk foon 
means to the roll around in the dust and you'll

see why would we go to make it now I say inspired 
by because I did change the method a little bit

to make it even better or at least I think it's 
better it's fried chicken tender and juicy and

it's taught in a toasted rice dust lots of herbs 
and oh my god if you like fried chicken this is a

must try with a cold glass of beer perfect let's 
get started so you know me I'm a scientist I like

to use chicken bye but you can use chicken breast 
if you like and I just cut it into strips like

this you know a couple of bites per piece is 
perfect now I'm going to marinate it a little

bit very simply with some fish sauce of course 
and some soy sauce and using Typhoid sauce now

if you want to make the Scouten free you can just 
do fish sauce a little bit of white pepper brown

white pepper and I'm just going to let this sit 
until we're ready to fry it it doesn't need to

be made you know hours in advance or anything 
and that's it now time to make our dust so the

dust is basically toasted rice powder with lots 
of herbs toasted and blended along with it's

going to be the seasoning coating on the chicken 
so good now I've made toasted rice powder many

times before and this is exactly the same method 
except apart from the rice I'm also going to add

some lemongrass galangal and kaffir lime leaf and 
toast everything all together and I'm just going

to pair my lime leaves up a little bit and remove 
that middle stem and everything is going to get

crispy and toasty right in here and now I'm just 
going to toast it over medium-high heat is okay

until the rice is the nice deep brown color and 
all the herbs are pretty much crispy once it's

deep brown with the toasty aroma it is done now 
going to let this cool a little bit and then we'll

blips it up while the rice is cooling I'm going 
to make the dipping sauce and I am making them

Dinsdale which is a North Eastern style dipping 
sauces really goes with any kind of meat but it's

especially good with chicken so I'm going to start 
out though with my palm sugar which I have finely

chopped because I'm not going to cook this sauce 
I want to make sure the sugar is dissolved and

going to put a little hot water over the sugar and 
just let that sit and sulk and soften a little bit

and it doesn't need to all dissolve completely 
now but if you do this by the time you're done

adding everything you're pretty much sure that 
there's no more little chunks that's good enough

that's about halfway dissolved and now fish sauce 
there you go and of course some lime juice for a

little tartness and to give it a little more body 
so the dip is not too runny in cinnamon and some

tamarind and also Tamron gives a kind of tartness 
that's a little more well-rounded so it's not so

sharp like if we were to use lime juice alone 
now Jim Jo is always spicy so I'm going to add

a generous amount of roasted chili flakes and 
I basically took dried chilies roasted in the

oven until it's smoky and ground it up you can 
use any kind of chili flakes that you have but

if you do the roast that kind you get nice smoky 
flavor now that looks like a lot and it is really

spicy but you don't have to put as much as I did 
for sure now the stuffings off is not quite done

yet I still have to add some cilantro which I'll 
leave to the end so that it's not wilted and also

the toasted rice dustin is going to bring this 
whole dish together I've transferred my toasted

rice and my herb here in the coffee grinder and 
I'm going to start seasoning it I'm adding some

white pepper and I'm going to add a little salt 
with a little hint of sweetness you won't barely

taste it but it's there to balance some sugar 
now as an option you can do this you don't have

to chili flake or anything spicy cayenne pepper 
whatever you have the dipping sauce is already

going to be spicy but for those of you who want 
to just eat the chicken on its own because the

chicken is also good on its own you can add the 
spicy right here okay I'm going to add it anyway

and now this blips it up into a fine dust Oh care 
for home breathe too quickly after you open it

because it was like chili dust and everything in 
the air so now that is magic powder right there

I'm going to transfer this into a big mixing 
bowl and then once we fry the chicken it can

come right in here and get rolled in the dust so 
I've got my oil heating up for frying but now I'm

going to toss my chicken into some cornstarch 
just to provide a little bit of a coating so

that it doesn't dry out too quickly in the frying 
oil you don't have to use cornstarch you can use

all-purpose flour or potato starch or whatever 
kind of flour you've got on hand it'll also

prevent the chicken from sticking to each other 
in the oil so now that the chicken looks mostly

coated I'm just going to throw them in a sieve 
just to shake off the excess flour and there's

something really fun and satisfying about doing 
this and that's it all right my oil is ready to

go the chicken goes right in and these will take 
one-and-a-half to two minutes and they are done so

traditionally what people do is they toss the 
raw chicken in the dust and then they fry the

chicken with the duck but we just totally fine 
and you can do that if you want but I just find

that you get less dust clinging that way because 
you move some in the fryer you know if I fry if I

toss the chicken in the dust after you get a lot 
of dust all right these are done that's how quick

it is and then I'm just going to put it right in 
this bowl for now because I still have another

batch to fry and now while the chickens do hot 
and bubbling you want to dump it into the dust

all right got a plate these these make great 
appetizers and look how much of that dust is

clinging on to the chicken this is perfect 
food now I'm going to finish that dipping

sauce so there it is I'm going to put some of 
the dust into that bowl right there and you can

put as much or as little as you like the more 
you put the thicker it's going to be and then

the cilantro you can do mint as well if you 
don't like cilantro or green onions oh yeah

and you want to ask the dust at the last minute 
because if you let it sit and swell up and then

settle at the bottom right now the refreshness 
do a little bit crunchy very nice look at that

what a great little appetizer plate if you have 
a glass of beer oh my gosh so perfect this one

right here looks perfect to me oh so good mmm if 
you like laughs it's got that same feel except

it's crunchy and spicy and Munchie the toasted 
rice gives that fun texture and the a wonderful

toasty aroma and all the lemongrass kaffir lime 
leaves at the lungo you can really smell all that

s you chew wow it's so it's so good so the recipe 
as a wave of yon Hut hike it seems calm when you

make it send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or 
Instagram if you haven't subscribed to the show

you know what to do click Subscribe right here and 
I will see you next time for you goodness times
